headline: Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole
description: This ham and hash brown casserole is a family-friendly dish made with hash brown potatoes and ham in a creamy sauce for a yummy, lazy day breakfast.

video.description: This casserole is everything you love about breakfast in one dish.
video.name: Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole

name: Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (32 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes
2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of potato soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Mix together hash browns, condensed soup, sour cream, Cheddar cheese, and ham in a bowl until well combined. Spread evenly into the prepared dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly brown, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: This is a fam fav!
Our new Christmas morning breakfast casserole! I add one more cup of sharp cheddar and double the ham for good measure :-)
This is a family favorite and quite popular with my co-workers.
I took it to a church potluck and it was the first thing gone.

Great recipe I have been using for years. The only difference for my version is I use dehydrated hashbrowns that you can soften with just a little hot water. Less watery than frozen. But either way it has been a hit.
I added more shredded cheese. Just a personal preference.

I love this casserole and so does everyone who has it. I add about a 1/2 cup of onions, 1/4 cup medium spicy peppers, and 1/2 cup bell peppers. It gives it a little zing. It's a very good recipe as is though.
Made it several times. Big hit at church luncheon
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
I made this recipe for Christmas brunch. Everyone loved it and it was very easy to make.
This was really good. I did add some diced onion, gr & red pepper I had around. I also had to do 1/2 sour cream and 1/2 plain yogurt 'cause I ran out.

Everyone who has tried this loves it! I also substitute different meat depending on what I cooked. My favorites are left over brisket or roast. I cut up the meat and throw it in a skillet for about 5 minutes before I mix it together. Can not go wrong with this.
Like others I added small diced onion and only once cup Parmesan cheese on top

Wow this is really yummya !Also has aNice presentation served in a glass casserole dish. Allowing for the vision of the bubbling ingredients beneath the golden brown top. I expected this dish to weigh in heavy but I suppose it isn’t heavy because it lacks eggs. I try to sneak in veggies when I can & added mini orange and red pepper rings & a bit of chopped onion. I split the measurements right down the middle (6 servings) for Hubs & I which afforded us a hearty dinner entree served with a side of jaw dropping bings (it’s all about the sweet and salty for me!) & accompanied eggs the next morning. Did I mention how easy to make and clean up is a breeze. Married nearly 40 years Im so over menu planning and cooking I just want to sew for my granddaughters and dote on my dog. Whose with me? Thanks all recipes you help make that possible with meals like these.
This was a delicious recipe! Because I already had them I used Potatoes O’Brien. We have this for brunch or dinner. Everyone loves it. Thanks so much for posting!
This casserole is yummy The only changes I made was adding more ham (1lb. total) And I served it over scrambled eggs And topped it with salsa Thanks for a great recipe
I really liked this, my brother and friend thought it was good too. I added about a cup and a half of frozen broccoli. Will make again.
I used sausage instead of ham and I made half a recipe. Also used hash brown O’Brien potatoes. Precooked potatoes and sausage. Delicious

I'm not sure about a breakfast casserole but I made this for a birthday dinner as a side dish. I use 1 can of cream of celery and 1 can of cream of mushroom and it was delicious! I covered this with tin foil until the last 3 minutes and then uncovered and turned on the broiler for the last 3 minutes to make the top a nice golden brown. It doesn't need any added salt but we all had to add black pepper. All and all excellent!
We don't eat pork so I couldn't use the ham, however, I substituted turkey bacon and it turned out delicious! Followed the recipe as written otherwise. Two thumbs up.

Very good! Made this tonight for the Family. Didn’t have any cream of potato so I substituted cream of mushroom. Also seasoned with Tony’s and Montreal Chicken Seasoning. Added dried minced onion and minced garlic.

We make this for breakfast when we have family get togethers. We usually make one with ham, and one with breakfast sausage. People always like the one with breakfast sausage better. So, now we follow the recipe, except sub breakfast sausage instead of ham.
Delicious!
I make this every Christmas morning!! A family favorite
This is so good. I did use Potato O'briens instead of regular hash browns for the additional flavor. Other than that I followed the recipe completely.

Okay, so I made this almost as recipe called for, I did substitute one can of the cream of potato for 1 can of half and half, added red, green diced bell and half a yellow onion diced. I used half sharp cheddar and half pepper jack ... this will forever and always be my go to Cheesy Hash Brown and Ham casserole, it's a 100! With a little country gravy ... shut the back door momma!

This recipe is an awesome breakfast main dish that the entire family loves. I also made it for my daughter’s swim team for breakfast after an early morning practice; received rave reviews and was gone in a flash. 

No substitutions to the recipe, but for advice, get the largest bowl you have to mix up all of the ingredients. The frozen hash browns may clump a little and when trying to coat and mix, they tend to spill over the sides a little bit.

Everyone loves when I make this dish. I do make it my own with a few changes. Instead of using 2 cans of cream of potatoes, I substitute with 1 can of cheddar cheese. I also add 1/2 cup fresh chopped green onions and 1/2 of diced onion. Great left overs too!
A great casserole meal for the colder months. I found it to be a bit heavy for warmer outside temps. But fills you up and keeps you warm and happy!

i had made this a few months ago and decided to make it again with a few changes - the first time it was a bit dry so instead of two cans cream of potato i did one can of potato, one of cream of mushroom and a can of cheddar soup - rest of the menu was the same - this made a lot creamer and a bit more cheesy

Great flavor combination. I made some changes by adding 2 finely chopped jalapeno peppers & a bag of frozen spinach, and substituted plain Greek yogurt for the sour cream & cream of mushroom for cream of potato soup. Adding the spinach made it too much for my 9" x 12" baking dish, so I ended up with a big pan & a smaller pan. I could have added 20 minutes to the baking time (I added 10, but it could have been browner.)

Anyway, it's a great recipe that I will be making again & again.
The recipe was basically good. It definitely needs extra ham and cheese. Season to taste, valways!! I added a little Mrs. Dash garlic and erb to help the flavor. It ended up fabulous!!

Followed the recipe, it was easy to make. I had a chunk of ham that was perfect for this. Should have sprayed the casserole dish with cooking spray first. The family loved it, even the 1 1/2 year old liked it. Made a salad as the side. Will definitely make this again.
This was so good! I couldn’t find any cream of potato soup so I substituted cream of chicken. I was worried this would ruin it, but it still turned out great (though very rich).
We like it best with cut- up cooked link sausages.
This turned out amazing!! I following the recipe exactly!! New family favorite!
I would wait until it’s cooled because that’s when it taste the best
I just used sprinkle parm instead. Also crushed up corn flakes for a crunchy topping. Very good. Very filling.

I absolutely loved the ingredients and the simplicity of this recipe, and I will try it again ... however ... it was super salty. Don't get me wrong, I am a very big salt fan, but it was too salty even for me. I am sure there are ways to tone that down and I will for sure attempt to make it again. I used it as a one pan dinner casserole to use up some left over ham, and served with a salad. Really hoping I can tone down the salt next time.

My husband and I really liked this casserole but I did make some changes to it. I used pork sausage (mild) instead of ham, added a small onion, about 1/2 c. of sliced mushrooms, and half of a large green pepper. I sautéed the veggies in the same pan that I cooked the pork sausage. I used 2 cans of mushroom soup which seemed to go along with the fresh mushrooms. And, last, I used pepperjack cheese instead of cheddar and still put the Parmesan cheese on the top. I mixed it all up, except for the Parmesan, put it in a casserole dish, and cooked as directed. Still similar to the original recipe, just changed the protein, added some veggies (oh, I sprinkled some oregano and thyme on the veggies when I sautéed them), changed the flavor of soup and cheese. Now I have my version and the original recipe still to try. I am sure it is equally as good! We really liked this and went back for seconds.
Nice and easy casserole!
Everyone in my family loved this dish. That doesn't often happen. It has become a favorite at our family's Easter Brunch.

We loved it! I made it for dinner to use up ham from my freezer. I added a lot more ham, 2 bags of frozen peas and thawed the hash browns. Combined those together and then added the liquid ingredients that were combined in a separate bowl. I only had 1 can of potato soup and 8 oz of sour cream so added 1 cup or so of milk. I made a second smaller casserole because it was overflowing my 9 x 13. It reheats well in the microwave. Came out delicious, moist and creamy not too cheesy. It's going into regular rotation for venison sausage instead of ham. I like that you can add any vegetable to customize the casserole.

Thanks for this recipe!
I think next time I will substitute the the cheddar with pepper jack & replace the ham with a saltier bruschetta. I used a lb of ham & it was barely noticeable with the strong sharp cheddar.
Very good. I added a little Frank's hot cause to kick it up a notch

I made this recipe but eliminated the ham because I was looking for a dish to compliment a ham dinner. It was amazing! I would make this dish again and again with ham, without ham. Don't substitute the cream of potato soup. It's the golden ticket. Bonus...if there are leftovers (big IF) it freezes really well. That's right folks IT FREEZES REALLY WELL! I froze individual portions of this great comfort food that I could reheat for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Go ahead. Make it. You won't be sorry. Rich, comforting, delicious food. Straight up.

This is an Awesome dish. My husband and neighbors and I absolutely devoured this dish. I did omit the Parmesan and added more of the cheddar per others recommendations. I will definitely make this again

I will definitely make this again. Great the way it is, but can be amended to use what is in the pantry. I substituted 1 can of cream of mushroom for the potato soup. I also sauteed an onion and celery and added those to the dish.
It was a big hit with Christmas dinner and am making it again tonight.
Delicious! I made this exactly as written (what a unique idea!) .
I make this every year for Christmas. I omit the ham, double the recipe, add a diced onion and use french’s onions on the top instead of Parmesan. Fantastic recipe!!
I used cream of bacon just because they were out of cream of potato. Great recipe for leftover holiday ham! :)
I added onions and it turned out wonderful. Would make it again
Delicious, creamy, cheese,wonderful. I served 10 people and it was gone!
Absolute hit at our family Christmas brunch! I wasn't sure that my family would go for it, but they devoured it and I got compliments from everyone! It will definitely be back for a Christmas 2020!
It was amazing!!! It will definitely become an easy family favorite. It was easy and inexpensive to make. It was a super long bake but was really worth it.
Changed the ham over to bacon, and it was still great. We cooked the bacon first, just to make sure it wouldn't still be raw.

HANDS DOWN BEST BREAKFAST CASSEROLE. I have made this for a few years now and for every work potluck. It would go so fast and people were sad so I started doubling it and it still all gets eaten. I make it as is but I also have added more ham (love ham!) and added a little mozzarella cheese. This is so simple yet so good and versatile. Thank you for the recipe!! :)

Made it as a main dish with a couple of veggies on the side and a hearty hot roll. I did add a medium onion as we love onions. 
 Was wonderful!!! House smells heavenly and everyone loved it. We will make this version again!!

I make this all the time. I always use double the ham. Rarely use the Parmesan. Crumble potato chips onto each portion after dishing it out. I share the food I cook as often as I possibly can and this is easily the crowd favorite of all my regular recipes.

The only thing I did was put tin foil on top and take it off the last 20min. It was a HIT with my fiance. The only thing we'd change next time is adding a little more ham and he wants corn flakes on top.

This is an amazing recipe. Have made it precisely and loved it! Have also made with O'Brien taters and a few shots of mild hot sauce like Tapatio to kick it up a notch for a dinner. 10/10 will make again.

I've made it the way the recipe calls for but prefer it with o'Brien hashbrowns, spicy breakfast sausage and different cheeses. I mix in one bag of cheddar jack and top with a bag of mild cheddar. I loosely covered for the first 20 minutes so the cheese wouldn't burn.

11.9.19 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/20096/cheesy-ham-and-hash-brown-casserole/ ... 'Followed the recipe enough to share a very valuable tip: Brown the hashbrowns or you're essentially having mashed potatoes with added ingredients. Maybe I'll stir it up & reheat to serve with meatloaf tomorrow. I'm not kidding.
Delicious and so easy to make! My family loved it!

This recipe is awesome! My toddler even liked it, so it's a keeper. I don't usually make a lot of potluck-style dishes, but after this, I'm gonna try more. Made the recipe as-written, except I cut down on the parmesan.

This is definitely a keeper! I used thick cut hash browns, doubled the potatoes and eggs. I used one 12oz can of evaporated milk and one can of Campbell’s fiesta Nacho Cheese soup.. I used 3 8-oz pks of diced ham, probably a cup of extra sharp cheddar cheese , about 4-6 oz of peppermint jack and spread Mexican cheese over the top. I had a 9x13 pan plus a deep dish pie plate. It was really good! I will probably brown the potatoes some next time. Very versatile recipe! As you see, I tweak everything!

okay, so this is obviously delicious per the flavorful ingredients (cheese, sour cream, cream of potato, more cheese). It's oh-so-creamy and cheese is gooey throughout. I used mild cheddar, but I wish I had used sharp instead (flavor would pop a bit more). With all that plain, white potato, stronger flavors can't hurt. One thing missing from the recipe that I think is essential is salt/pepper. I added some, but could have used a bit more (I guess I was relying on the parm to work on its own.) By the way, the parm was good, but maybe could use a little less (and more time for it to brown, perhaps?) I think a nice layer of cheddar on top would be good as well, instead of parmesan, but it was good either way.

This is always at our holiday breakfast. Sometimes with meat and sometimes without. I often use Greek yogurt instead of sour cream just because it’s always in my fridge. I do usually let mine cook a bit longer than suggested though.

as a huge fan of cheese, even for me there was way too much parm on the top. It was just too heavy handed. Next time I will try adding some veg. Maybe mushrooms, cooked up onions, red peppers etc.. Could use a little more ham too.
I saved your recipe some years ago and have made it numerous times and it is one of my families favorites!!!
Yes I added corn, cream of chicken, no flower, sour cream, and baked it at 425 for 30 min than 375 for 15 minutes or until bubbling and golden brown on top.

This is a great base recipe for a cheesy hash brown casserole. I substituted a 16 oz. kielbasa cut into small pieces for the ham and cream of chicken soup (instead of potato). I also added two teaspoons of dried onion flakes and one and a half teaspoons of powdered ranch dressing mix (like Uncle Dan's) to the potato mixture before baking. To top it off, I sprinkled one and a half cups crushed butter crackers (Ritz) over the casserole and added the parmesan cheese on top of that. Despite thawing the hash browns before using, this recipe needs at least 70-75 minutes to cook potatoes and meld flavors. My family enjoyed this dish, and my teenage kids said the crunchy top tasted like Cheese-it crackers; I will be making this again.
I made it as directed and it was good, but I think it could have used a little more flavor. I'm going to switch up the recipe just a bit next time and try cream of bacon instead of cream of potato
Really easy dish and tasty too. Since there are only two of us, I cut all ingredients in half except the ham. Cooked in ceramic pie dish. Enough for two meals for two people.

This was delicious. The only changes I made were because of lack of supplies. I used a little less sour cream. And I exchanged 1 cup of the cheddar for walmart's fiesta mix, because that's what I had. Still turned out wonderful.

We made this for a church event. It disappeared so fast I didn't get any. I did taste it after cooking it to make sure it was good. Everyone loved it and tried to come back for more, but it was gone. Going to make it again, just for us this time.

Made this for a huge family gathering. Everyone loved it, even my 1 year old Grandson.
The only thing I changed was I swapped bacon bits for ham.
The only thing I would do differently next time, I would not put shredded parmesan on top. I would use grated parmesan. The reason for this is the grated parmesan formed a thick crust that you couldn't cut through. Thank you for a fantastic recipe.

This recipe is one of the best breakfast casserole recipes because it’s simple and easy. Since I am vegetarian I didn’t add the ham and it still tasted like heaven. I made it for Father’s Day and my dad loved it.
Made it to the “T”. I did not make any adjustments to the receipt. Does not need any modifications! Tasty and simple. Love it!
Really easy and delicious. I might add some onion next time I make it.
This dish was eaten so quickly I don't think there were any leftovers. I subbed ham for bacon but it was still delicious! Definitely in my top 10
This is a staple dish at my families’ Christmas brunch. I follow the recipe exactly and it is SO FREAKING YUMMY! There are never any leftovers.

I made this for a work potluck and it was pretty well received. I modified the recipe slightly to include some sautéed diced onion and tri color peppers, subbed bacon for ham. Without the veggies, this would have been too one note for my group. I give high remarks because it is a super fast dish to put together and tastes good!
Love this recipe. There are only two people in my house so it's easy to cut this recipe in half. When the grocery store has ham slices on sale I go for this recipe.

It’s a keeper!!! This was absolutely delicious! I used 2 20 oz pkgs of hash browns since I couldn’t find a 32 oz pkg, increased the ham cubes to 2 cups (that’s what came in the packaged bag) and decreased the Parmesan cheese to 3/4 cup. Other then that, I followed the recipe exactly, it was so easy to make and was a super hit with older teenage eating machines!

I have made this 1000 times and every time it comes out perfect and awesome!! I make it the way it says BUT sometimes I don't add the ham. I also add a little 1/2 and 1/2 to thin it out. it get a little too thick at the end if baking. the 1/2 and 1/2 makes it creamy cheesy good
Very Good!

I'd rather have this with eggs than all of the potato. It ends up pretty tangy from the parmesan and sour cream, but was surprisingly still a little runny. I may try it again adding eggs to see if I like it better.
Trust all these 5 star reviews. This is delicious. Make it as is. Yum!
Super rich, super creamy! Next time I make it, I might add more potatoes or even a vegetable like peas. A nice way to use leftover holiday ham.

Delicious and easy. The only change I made was adding a half cup of chopped onion, which rounded out the delicious blend of flavors. I made only half this recipe and still it was enough for three meals for two people. I will definitely make this again!
It is tasty, but seems overwhelming with cheese.
Wonderful! May think about added eggs next time as well! Also need to add a little salt and pepper!

This casserole tasted great following the recipe as is. The one less star was due to the texture of the parm cheese topping, which came out as a leathery crust. This recipe is a keeper, but will top with more cheddar or Colby jack as suggested by another reviewer.

Made just as is. But this recipe is HUGE. We had five people and this will really feed a large group at a gathering. Very rich, tasty and comfortlike, with the texture of a mac n' cheese dish. Anyone will love it, especially if group includes children who don't like green vegetables :)

Made just as is. But this recipe is HUGE. We had five people and this will really feed a large group at a gathering. Very rich, tasty and comfortlike, with the texture of a mac n' cheese dish. Anyone will love it, especially if group includes children who don't like green vegetables :)
Loved it. Easy to make and goes fast. Will have to double it. Thanks Diana

I made this. My wife loved it so I will make it again. I used no salt. Between the ham and the soup there was plenty. I add a can of mushrooms. Next time I think I will saute onions and fresh mushrooms. It is easy and it is a keeper.

item.name: Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole
